text:
Lovely example of animating the #SVG viewbox on a complex graphic.
https://t.co/dUP8rGwSMb  https://t.co/tVHLjRoYon

@anatudor @erikdahlstrom It's one of the new stroke proposals that are on hold for now, but are planned eventually:
https://t.co/lduXCpkfEo
@Mamboleoo @anatudor Yep. Has no effect in browsers, so safe to dump. Replaced with mix-blend-modes and eventually by background-filter.
@ChrisGannon If it's a browser painting problem, could try `will-change: transform`. If it's GSAP initialization, maybe an initial delay?
@SaraSoueidan …and when SVG isn't possible as a substitute for GIF, you should probably be using a <video> instead!
@MikeMJHarris It's on my radar as something I would like to get into the SVG spec, but it won't be in SVG 2 for next year.
@n3wjack Thanks! (& I'm good, it seems) That's a really smart way of building an easy test & proof of why it's a problem, all in one.
@MikeMJHarris It has been mentioned. There's a proposed canvas text-to-path function & a font API within Houdini project. But nothing yet.
@stevefaulkner Umm, not sure about wording of the tweet/heading (hidden may affect name-from-contents), but the section is good information.

Looks like my older Dell laptop is OK.
Use certmgr.msc from Start menu to view certificates, look for eDellRoot. https://t.co/FWsacXxDdV

Dear #lazyweb,
Is there a quick how-to available yet on how to find if you're affected by the Dell security certificate problem & fix if so?
@codepo8 Thank you, I needed that.

@vlh @rachsmithtweets
So… yeah, if you weren't previously following @BaliBaloPG on CodePen, do that! So many great animations in CSS/canvas.
@brnnbrn Ugh, indeed. Also makes me wonder why the copywriter gets tasked as substitute receptionist. My guess: last one was a young woman.
@rachelnabors Also, pin hole camera kits? Haven't seen that before!
@rachelnabors +1 to making friends with people who have different but complementary skill sets!

@rachsmithtweets @vlh @beesandbombs Have you seen @BaliBaloPG's CodePen version?
https://t.co/qHzGVN0Cpm

@Mamboleoo Mais oui! J'suis canadienne…
Mais les petits nuances d'usage sont desfois hors de ma comprehension, avec fr-CA même que fr-BE!
@Mamboleoo @benjamincrozat J'ai toujours pensé que belle-mère était plus gentile phrase que mother-in-law—mais non si vous l'associé à ça!
@brucel But, click fees are an easier to measure metric than people leaving in disgust & assuming your magazine just re-publishes that crap.
@brucel I can't understand why some otherwise-respectable publications allow that crap on their pages. The click fees _can't_ be worth it.
@sarah_edo I now understand the impetus between some of your crazy mechanical interactives. Turn a crank to build a gorgeous fantasy scene!

@steltenpower The goal is to get a stable draft in February, but there will probably be some clean-up after that.
@SaraSoueidan @Mamboleoo

@Mamboleoo @SaraSoueidan Make noise towards browser implementers!
Or, if you're really keen & know C++, dive into Firefox source code!
@SaraSoueidan @Mamboleoo To clarify: SVG 2 as a whole will be finalized 2016, but height/width/x/y as CSS are for sure, waiting on browsers.
@SaraSoueidan @Mamboleoo Ooops, yes, sorry: wasn't looking closely. Yes, height of a <rect> as a CSS property is new, only in Chrome so far.
@SaraSoueidan @Mamboleoo This isn't really an SVG2-specific thing. More just a bug. height of <svg> in HTML should follow normal CSS layout.

I don't often work with bitmapped graphics, but when I do, I always use GIMP.

Love the classy new look, @patdavid! https://t.co/D9ZNXA5QPR
@Mamboleoo So glad to see you're weathering the scares with sense of humour intact!

@Tweetsfromyow @kittythefool I don't think any song on the subject could match Eric Bogle's "Nobody's Moggy":
https://t.co/8r1lULM676
RT @codepo8: Breaking news leads to fact shards.
@sten_muchow @snookca @sarah_edo I love that there's a global invasion of giant spiders weaving a web of art appreciation around the Earth.
@sarah_edo @svgeesus In addition, I'd like to see a calligraphy pen stroke, defined by the pen shape/angle rather than by padding the path.
@sarah_edo @svgeesus Straightforward authoring, but still lots of Qs on how to smooth curves, deal with corners & efficiently calculate it.
@rem Ugh, yes. When this happened to me, I was so surprised that this seemed to be the normal way Apple batteries are expected to fail!

@ThatEmil Thanks for testing! Might fix the "2 objects" by also putting role=presentation on the <text>.
PS The SVG-AAM should help w/ this!

@tigt_ @sarah_edo @svgeesus At one point, there was a (rough) draft spec, got taken out, may make it to SVG Strokes:
https://t.co/7vPWGTurQI

To all politicians of today,
Before you speak, ask: will future politicians debate the ethics of your infanticide? https://t.co/gLThe9G7Ig

@jsutt +1
I'm not fond of #a11y (insider-y unpronounceable acronym doesn't seem very accessible to me) but it's the standard, stick with it!
@rachelnabors @PWDO It's awesome that you were able to (and willing to) arrange this workshop last minute when your life turned upside down!
@ThatEmil Oooh, that's a new one for me. xml:preserve support is pretty horrible in general, but that's just wacky.
I really love how many former drunken party girls are now getting into web development—judging from my Twitter new followers' list, anyway!
@ThatEmil Should be, anyway—haven't tested properly! The presentation role says ignore markup &pass through content, like for table layouts.
@ThatEmil <h1><svg role="presentation"><text>Hello 'n stuff</text></svg></h1> is enough, unless accessible label differs from text content.

@AmeliasBrain Don't want to read an entire feature article? @omar_aok tweeted his own TL;DR listing of top 10 facts:
https://t.co/ByI6w0k75Z
Fascinating history of the sweet&spicy Alberta donair, and why it differs from the tzatziki tang I knew in Ottawa. https://t.co/S2TkkACJLH
@meyerweb If you haven't already written it, a nice meta wrap-up could discuss the impact of writing on personal topics for a tech audience.
@jake_albaugh I wonder if screen readers say it that way? They pronounce URL as "urrl". An "appy" API makes just as much phonetic sense.
@jake_albaugh I'm clearly not up for twitter trolling with you. I'd be totally down for mocking you over a beer—if you weren't in Chicago.
@jake_albaugh That would not be awesome.
@jake_albaugh Maybe. Depends on whether your friend is a trolling grammar pedant like you…
@jake_albaugh Definitely an "up for it" situation, then. "I am totally down" is when your friend suggests something unexpected but awesome.

@jake_albaugh
"up for it"=I have energy/stamina/mild interest
"down for it" (or just "down")=I am committed/enthusiastic

P.S. What's "it"?
@_hmig Oh, I understand—no worries! I try so hard not to make promises, but I always end up feeling guilty for the things I said I'd do…
@GregorAdams Ah, hadn't looked at the markup, didn't realize there was nested content/flattening issues. @tmrDevelops @CodePen
@tmrDevelops @GregorAdams @CodePen Woah! Love the 3D blocks & that the info is still all usable. (…maybe an overflow:scroll on descriptions)
RT @triketora: Why Marissa Mayer is too hot to be Yahoo’s CEO: The case against hiring women.  https://t.co/uT2qHrEhve
@jeffbigham And yet, right this moment, someone else is using Google search to find and load their web email client.
@kizmarh It would be really nice to at least have CSS max/min functions and ideally a ternary operator equivalent to (variable > x)? a:b;
@LeaVerou Fair enough. Maybe that's the key to not being a hypocrite: focus on the why behind the best practice, i.e., on clear DRY code.
@LeaVerou One difference is DRY coding. A parameterizable template versus multiple hard-coded onEvent attributes for each button/field/etc.
@AmeliasBrain Found an error myself. All references to non-existent `xml:title` attribute should be to (deprecated) `xlink:title` attribute.
@anatudor @fabiovenni If that's easier. No blend mode will turn an opaque layer transparent. Compositing modes could, but not in CSS yet.

@anatudor @fabiovenni Then you need to use border-image: linear-gradient(), not background.
https://t.co/pKw6C6Rg3G

@AmeliasBrain P.P.S., This is only one of many draft ARIA specs & guides that were updated today:
https://t.co/FnJA51pg0d
New work (with tutorial!) from the awesome @LegoMushroom. https://t.co/RxCNwCnEDS
@AmeliasBrain P.S., If the whole spec is somewhat overwhelming, focus on the Editor's Notes, which describe issues we're still unsure of.

Dear #SVG nerds and #a11y nerds:
I would love your feedback & examples on a draft spec for how SVG+ARIA should work
https://t.co/edcTN1MTbX

@rachelnabors Cuter than the cockroaches, anyway?

Wonder if they eat the roaches, too?
@LeaVerou Especially true if the re-factor doesn't have an immediate, measurable performance impact—only long term dev efficiency impact!
@svgeesus @tabatkins @LeaVerou @SimonSapin +1 to Unicode-block keywords. Ranges with characters aren't much more intuitive than codepoints.

When the chicken is so tender you can slice it by poking it with a wooden spatula, you know the stew is ready.

BRB. Netflix and chew.
@HenriHelvetica @SaraSoueidan SVG are great for file size & resolution, but rendering (particularly filters & animation) can be slow.

@DavidGogoBlues @talker1 This isn't the track they played on @ckuaradio, but it's fun. If you keep your mind clean.
https://t.co/SX5rDT4DrY
@DavidGogoBlues @talker1 Same reaction here. You've ruined the word Gogo for Cdn blues fans. But not in New Orleans: https://t.co/vH3zSmG6Pv
@MMosley Clearly designed in the land of sandy playgrounds. Maybe try brushing it out w/ a wire pet brush, but it might pull too much fluff.
@jcdsvg The original code had hard-coded line breaks & extra spans for the line-end effect. The trick was to do it on a natural paragraph.
@AmeliasBrain ALT=Map of US states who've "surrendered to ISIS by promising not to aid or house victims" vs those who've told ISIS to F off.

Sometimes, quality in data visualization is all about clear, to-the-point labels.
https://t.co/p9vijmkUL3 https://t.co/ZVZZzgnjII

https://t.co/7XWAnIALbM
If you don't know the answer, look at other's responses for an introduction to the box-decoration-break property. https://t.co/uFwlcG3Sv1
@swartable Yes, I'm hoping I can separate out the "don't want to miss a thing" accounts from the "interesting, if I have time" accounts.

Trying a new Twitter strategy:
❶Sort everyone I follow into lists
❷Follow everyone I was stalking via lists
❸Only use lists to read tweets
@codepo8 @jacobrossi @cwilso I still love that I can hack/guess a URL. Even the redundant :// punctuation enabled protocol-relative URLs.
@anatudor This is one reason clip-path: path(…) will be good. But I'd also like a more generic solution. Have an idea, need to write it up.
@helenvholmes Yes, filters are applied in order. For those two (opacity/blur), the difference will be minimal, for others could be extreme.
@anatudor By the way, this will get easier! Path syntax in CSS shapes is part of Shapes Level 2, some browser devs already working on it.
@MateiCopot I'm always uncertain whether to use "Chromium" or "Blink" when talking about the browser code but not that specific browser.
@supersole Can I just say that "Workday is crashing Nightly" is a fabulous bug report title if you read it as plain English.

Some people give money to charities at Christmas.
Other people give money to the electricity company.

Very, very bright.
https://t.co/8BLZMYMVzK
@TonyDiteodoro @MonkeyJunkBand So… how long was the debate on which song to drop, once you realized you were 26 seconds over time on side B?
People opened their doors to strangers, knowing there were many times more victims than monsters, & that it could as easily be themselves.

@kcarter80 Side effect of the default inline display mode for SVG in HTML. See reply on SO with corrected demo.
@chriscoyier @SaraSoueidan

Sad to see a Canadian leader on this bandwagon: https://t.co/QNmmlHqG6x

In the worst horror, Parisiens offered #PorteOuverte. Why can't we?
@gary_schroeder A word is real if people understand it. It starts as jargon, understood within a given trade—maybe even local dialect in SF!
@Una Anonymous won't likely be a direct help to people living in Iraq/Syria, but they're really the best bet to disrupt recruiting networks.
@anatudor @JDStringfellow Then best guess is it's hardware-specific—Chrome expecting your GPU to do something it doesn't. File a bug report?
@anatudor @JDStringfellow Could be a Chrome/Linux bug, or maybe an issue with an older GPU on your laptop doing something non-standard.
@anatudor @JDStringfellow Works in 46/Win for me. I do have "experimental web platform features" on, but blends should be standard since 41.
@jackrugile @jake_albaugh (or am I the only one who does that? 'Cause I do it all the time, looking for the motion in peripheral vision…)
@jackrugile @jake_albaugh Would be strange if unexpected, but very useful when you've got 3 monitors & are waving mouse to find the cursor.
@anatudor @w3unpocodetodo I think `isolation` for blend modes is not a well known term. But it's like `clear` vs `float`: you need both!
RT @w3unpocodetodo: @anatudor I'm reading @AmeliasBrain book about SVG colors. She mention isolation so I wanted to try it.
@w3unpocodetodo @anatudor Glad to hear it, Gabi! I didn't really go in depth with blend modes, so I'm glad it was enough to get you curious!
RT @rachelnabors: If museums represent a population's culture, then its malls must represent its aspirations.
@SaraSoueidan Not in this case—I was actually 5hrs back in the infinite scroll feed, then I re-tweeted this & @Twitter lost my spot. Urgh!!!
(Haven't read this carefully yet, but it's by @SaraSoueidan, so sure to be full of great #SVG tips!) https://t.co/eGfoM43Kb2
@AmeliasBrain (Context: Pre-renos, the Yale was a legendary live blues venue & my regular haunt the 3 years I lived in Vancouver.)
@AmeliasBrain Seriously, their Twitter & every article talks about the mechanical bull, and the promise of live music seems an afterthought?

4yrs after closing for renos, Vancouver's Yale re-opens as a kitschy Saloon.
No live music listings yet—just a bull. https://t.co/18USaWUuFn

@jake_albaugh Looks like a lovely view, droning traffic noise not included.

Also, you weren't kidding about cutting off all the hair!
@heydonworks The tumblr indenting matches email chains, including the margin line & ability to insert comments in middle of someone else's.
@jwjonesblues The best musicians make the old songs sound fresh and their new originals sound classic. So…all of the above!
@DavidGogoBlues @RainbowBistro But I don't think they have @TonyDiteodoro with a page-boy haircut; used to see it in the entry to Tucson's.
@DavidGogoBlues The @RainbowBistro has some good old glossies. I admit I smirked at teenage @jwjonesblues & @stevemarriner last I was there.

Sorry, @MateiCopot!

@SaraSoueidan @rem …even though Lebanon has been peaceful til this week.

PS Hope you're doing ok. I kept watch on your feed after the news.
@SaraSoueidan @rem Paris gets more coverage because it scares people more, breaks down the mental borders we put between "safe" and "war".
@SaraSoueidan @rem The Beirut attacks were covered a bit here. But I think to too many in Europe & N.Am, Lebanon=Middle East=another world.

@anatudor @ChrisGannon You trust the people who made it, to test & deal with bugs.

Sometimes, you just live dangerously for a fun Codepen.
@ChrisGannon @anatudor My suggestion was that for non-interactives, would be nice to have a compiler that subset to only have code you use.
@ChrisGannon @anatudor Yes. Libraries take a while to learn, but once you do they can be powerful tools.
@anatudor My advice would be, let it go unless it's used somewhere very public. If someone has "web dev" list, that's a personal shorthand.
@anatudor @ChrisGannon I think the message here is most of the value of libraries is in the math. Should be able to compile to simpler code!
@anatudor It seems the only way to prevent being added to a list is to block the user, which may be extreme. Are lists a problem for you?
@antimytheme And the best part—you get completely different patterns on different browsers. (Repeating gradients are fun for this, too!)
@AmeliasBrain Also, emphasize semantic elements: Content in <main> weighted heavily, consider links in proper <address> and <nav> sections.
Love to see this. e.g., disregard content not accessible by keyboard nav, & if that means only content is a pop-up… https://t.co/4D09L7jbPQ
@chaals I started to do this, then realized I'd have to set up a Cyrillic keyboard to do some of them, so it shifted to the back-burner…
@meyerweb @tabatkins Nor I. But you've already got a good test case, Eric, so you're halfway there. Ping us with a link when you've got it!

@nandronikos Wait—not sure I should like that! I wrote a lot of that text!
And it's got examples like this: https://t.co/hoLbmR8DFg
@gryghostvisuals Whoever it was @MSEdgeDev that came up with the "Boom! It's Done" copy is brilliant. Makes me want to answer "_Oh_, yeah!"

@sarah_edo @anatudor
@sarah_edo @anatudor My initials are abbr, so my abbreviated name is the abbreviation for abbreviations. Which is fun, but bad SEO!
@ShaneHudson Depends how warm the water & how thick the meat. With very cold water, it's safe to leave for >hr. But hot tap water is faster!
@ShaneHudson Reliable defrost method: Wrap well with plastic or place in zip-lock bag (squeezing out air), put in sink and cover with water.
@AmeliasBrain But seriously, highly recommended if y'all are in Nashville, and enjoy roots/blues/country/rock/any music that does not suck.

The Rotting Matadors??

@stevefaulkner @surkovalexander @sundress Thanks, yes, the HTML changes don't make sense without the AcName changes: https://t.co/HpqdXZC3ao
@htmlnate Hmm, yes, don't know why they hide the cool features. I remember the awe when I discovered the Win calculator's advanced views!
@htmlnate Char map is great because you can search by char name: eg "circled" for ❶/ⓐ or "arrow". But it's font-specific, which is annoying…
@htmlnate @tmrDevelops I make extensive use of the Windows character map utility while on Twitter. But you can just copy from my tweet!

@htmlnate @tmrDevelops I think title + author is usually enough. P.S. you could save some chars with proper typography:
title—by author: URL
@rem @SaraSoueidan Yes. JS should be active in SVG-as-iframe or SVG-as-object. Regular sandboxing rules apply for iframes.
@noahblon @twholman When you've stared at the web page so long your eyes can't focus, clearly it's time to cave to your colleague's idea?
@anatudor Whoops! I've made that style of mistake before: changing so many things, looking for the big problem, end up overlooking typos!
RT @malonebarry: If this was a Western journalist you'd know his name. https://t.co/QkLwdMVvxI https://t.co/CxEovtkcif
@anatudor Clip-paths are always calculated in the transformed coordinate system. Solution is nested groups: clip parent, transform child.
@anatudor The order *shouldn't* matter, but there were bugs in some Safari versionw, it wouldn't find re-used content later in the file.
@MikeMJHarris @CodePen Hehehe! But if people complain of perf, they'll eventually figure out SVGSVGElement.pauseAnimations()!
@ThatEmil Some sort of shortcut optimization trick going wild. A reminder that no test suite can replace a careful logic review of code.
RT @ThatEmil: Oh, IE lets iframed SVG <symbols> overflow the iframe container... Cool, cool. Oh, but only if there are ID collisions.
@ThatEmil I'm not sure if you have a wonderful attitude about this, or if you're suffering brain damage from hitting your head on the desk…

@rem @WebReflection Might want to use proper word break RegEx markers instead of whitespace, in case your bad word bear uses punctuation.
@WebReflection @rem This might be the best approach. Let the whiz kids who build the node JS RegEx engine optimize for you.
@rem If your 450 words rarely change, might be worth building a decision tree, then scanning the string once yourself. 450✖indexOf adds up.
